11.5.19  12:22 pm   so are you saying i can learn gospel music  by listening to the songs and then figuring out what the musicians are playing especially the parts that make me go OH JESUS

     you can learn the music without even really caring what the players are playing, but if you want to learn to play it, then you're gonna wanna know what they are playing. hope that makes sense

11.5.19  12:12 pm   Bill, you talk about how in order to have absolute pitch, you need some reference point(s) that were instilled from a very young age. But what I do is I compare the note to a pre-selected list of songs, and I can tell the note's pitch by what song it matches. It's not always snap-instant, but I can usually get at least a half-step around the true note.

     exactly, that's mostly how i do it. but, .... can you do it while another song is playing

      And these songs are ones I have only discovered very recently. So my question: does being able to remember and sing a song in key count as, or at least approximate, absolute pitch?

     to put it to the test you should try to get it to work while another song is playing, and compare it to obtain that song's key. but i will tell you something ironic. you will hear the experts say "no, that doesn't count, that's just sonic memory. the real absolute pitchers can do it instantly." But for me, here's the twist: every single person i've ever met who claims to have absolute pitch, i test them on it and they fail miserably.... by way more than a half step

11.5.19  11:45 am   how long does it take you to find an idea for a song? Like what you want to make a song about. Even though most of your music is kinda random there has to be a process to it. Right?

     i have very stringient criteria, which is that it has to be something i think would totally blow my mind, if i heard it for the first time. i don't know how i learned to come up with things that satisfy this criteria, except to say that it took many years of experimentation. sometimes the best ideas come without warning, so a reliable system for capturing those ideas is needed

11.5.19  11:24 am   Release your new song PLEASE (!)

     i will

11.5.19  10:10 am   Do you do all your own music?

     yes

11.5.19  9:10 am   who or what are your biggest inspirations to create music?

     no one, it's the music itself. but, i must confess to being a human, it's really [the quality of the music] combined with [whatever context it is placed in], that combination is what works its true magic. but i am keenly aware when the combination works particularly firely

11.5.19  8:11 am   do you still use the same mic as you started?

     i switched mics in 2011, and i still have that one. i still have the one i used before, which is actually a webcam. i started using it for a mic in 2008. before that, i was using the internal computer mic. i still have that computer but i don't use it. before that i didn't use any mic for several years, but i did use a mic around 2005, which was the internal mic in the computer, that computer i don't still have. before that i think i was using a normal mic which i don't think i have. and before that i went many years without using a mic, and i think there were times before that when i used mics but i assume i don't have them any more

11.5.19  8:04 am   do you ever wish you didn't have to answer these questions?

     no but sometimes i wish the earth wasn't so flat all the time

11.5.19  7:30 am   Bill, do you play any games in your spare time? And if so what games

     i'd prefer to make the game. wait, what the heck is spare time

11.5.19  7:12 am   Help everyone says that I'm too "perfectionist" and that I should just give things in without them being good and that it's better than never finishing them but I won't sleep knowing that I turned in bullshit to my teachers cause then they'd be like "ah look at this stupid kid aiming for an 80" and I'd look lazy even though I already am lazy cause I'm too scared of doing the assignments in the first place. So is the bullshit actually benevolent or should I actually become notstupid so that I can do things perfectly on time?

     who are these teachers and why is their opinion so vitally important to you? are they superteachers?

11.4.19  10:22 pm   What are stuffed animals?

      they are either happy pillows, or dead animals, depending on which kind you get

11.4.19  10:04 pm   What do you call that thing you do where (for example in the song "tuesday", ~20s), the chords are all like:
| Cmaj7 | Cm7/Eb | Bbmaj7 | F13 or something |
I find it has a very distinctive sound and it's really cool and all that.
???

     those aren't the right chords, but that's an old trick i like to call .................................. music! that particular bit is probably a good example of something i would never be able to achieve if i weren't writing the melody, lyrics, and chords at the exact same time. i was also sitting in the new york public library with earplugs in, which i think helps to strengthen the imagination, and always makes songwriting more focused and vivid, while staying adventurous

11.4.19  10:01 pm   i remember when i saw blue man group at age, like, 10 or 11 and i laughed so hard i cried. frickin loved every second of it. so i got my dad to buy me the dvd they were selling at the merch stand. but there was a bit in the dvd that wasn't in the live performance that involved a clip of some lady gagging and barfing into a vacuum like tube funnel thing. i'm severely, severely emetophobic and immediately ran out of the room covering my ears and hyperventilating and i haven't been able to bring myself to watch anything related to blue man group since. which sucks and i realize if i continue having this reaction to all forms of entertainment that have barf in them, i will eventually have a serious problem with limiting my options. also i don't wanna go to therapy over this if i can avoid it because being psychoanalyzed rubs me the wrong way for some reason. do you have any advice on how i can unfuck my reactions so i can enjoy stuff without worried abo ut unexp ectedly being thrown into a vortex of soul-eating, brain-screaming panic and horror? thanks

     barf is gross, i don't like it either

11.4.19  8:15 pm   I always try to write songs but the words get all tangled and trip on each other and start trying to knife each other on the ground. If I want to make a song how do I keep the words alive long enough for someone to listen to them and then want to listen again?

Thank you for the müsiks

     for now you could try simple words like "hey", "hi", "i am having a good day", etc. just as a starting point
